deck: Kaltor was an Atlantean mentor to Aquaman. They met when Arthur was a teenager just starting to explore his powers. Kaltor trained him and taught him about life at sea. Years later, they met in less pleasant circumstances.
description:
Kaltor was a heroic warrior of the sea who had passed his work ethic to his "little minnow". But his risk-taking ended up costing him dearly. He was rescuing trapped Atlanteas from a collapsed mine when exposed to a gas of unknown origins. Kaltor started to periodically change into a two-headed monster of giant proportions. In this form he had no control of his actions. The hero would go on mindless rampages. 
 
Unable to stop himself, Kaltor went after the "little minnow" who had become a King of Atlantis. He claimed to have been trying to destroy the monster for some time. But supposedly felt his battle prowess waning while his years advanced. He bound Aquaman with a sacred oath to kill the beast if Kaltor himself could not. A later encounter established that Kaltor had manipulated into killing him. Though honor-bound, Aquaman was reluctant to face his mentor.  
 
When forced to choose between killing Kaltor or witness him killing Mera and Aqualad, Arthur took the first option. He confronted Kaltor with a sword in his hand. When that sword broke, Arthur forged another one out of shell. The beast finally fell to his blows. The beast was death but its form released a live Kaltor, now freed from his shape-shifting curse.
name: Kaltor

deck: Starene was the daughter of Kaltor. Mera was afraid the girl was a rival for Aquaman's affections. Instead she was the first love interest to Aqualad.
name: Starene

deck: Green Lantern of Sector 3399
description: The Green Lantern known only as the Emissary to Space Sector 3399 was sent by the Guardians on a mission to traverse an unknown void and expose Space Sector 3399 to the light of the Green Lantern Corps. The Emissary completed its mission within the millennial span of its life; passing its ring on the the Green Lantern Shilandra Thane before dying of old age.
name: Emissary to Space Sector 3399

deck: Kandor is the lover of Hila and an enemy to Aquaman. He has mind-controlling skills and genetically engineered his own army.
description:
Creation

Kandor was created by Nick Cardy and Bob Haney.

Major Story Arcs

Aquaman

Kandor was exiled from Dimension Aqua along with Mera's identical twin sister Hila. Hila tracked down her sister, who was now Queen of Atlantis, and asked her to help free her of Kandor's hold over her. Aquaman and Mera travel to Kandor's lair and Mera enters alone, pretending to be her sister delivering the jewelled starfish. She finds a robed toad upon the throne and believes it to be a mutated Kandor. The real Kandor takes her by surprise and as Mera calls for help it is revealed that Aquaman is already a captive.

It was Kandor and Hila's plan all along to capture Aquaman. Kandor's ultimate goal was to locate the "Seven Golden Eels" and take their power for his own. Aquaman refuses to reveal their location so Kandor threatens the Sea King. First by hurling harpoons at Aquaman, who manages to dodge them. Then by trying to crush him with a pendulum, but once again Aquaman survives. Finally, Kandor sends his army of armadillo men to attack Aquaman, but they too are defeated. Kandor lashes out at Aquaman himself when his army fails and is able to gain the upper hand.

Hila then intervenes to stop Kandor killing the Sea King. Mera's native abilities are returned to her but then she is gassed by Kandor who believes her to be Hila, the gas putting her under his control. He makes her fight the real Hila and Mera wins, injuring her sister. This is when Kandor realizes his mistake and rushes to his lover's side. Kandor's armadillo warriors decide to revolt and try to crush their former leader with a giant, spiked, roller wheel. Mera creates a ramp out of hard water and stops the roller. Kandor then releases Mera from his control as Aqualad arrives. Aqualad has news from Dimension Aqua - Hila and Kandor's exile had been cleared and they could return to Dimension Aqua.

deck: A Japanese heroine who uses high-tech weapons including a heavily-armed motorcycle, right-arm flamethrower, and senses-augmenting cyber-helmet.
description:
Origin

Arashi develops her own technology to defend Japan. She once battled Doctor Polaris alongside The Ray and Green Lantern (Kyle Rayner). The threesome defeated Doctor Polaris and saved Japan from a giant tsunami. But Arashi was nearly killed by Doctor Polaris, who also broke her arm. Fortunately, she has recovered, and still actively defends her country.

Powers and Abilities

Arashi has no known meta-human abilities. However, she makes her own gadgets to fight crime. She uses an armed motorcycle, flamethrower, and cyber-helmet.
name: Arashi

deck: Who knew Voodoo could be so heroic?
description:
Origin

In the jungles of Brazil, Dr. Hal Carey's parents gave their lives tending to the natives, to be specific a tribe called the Blancas (because they were “white Indians“), and raised their son Hal to take over for them after they die.

Shortly after this happens he defeats the medicine man Okoro and becomes the leader of the tribe, from there daring do ensues. 

During his career medicine plays very little in the adventures of Dr. Voodoo and his girl-friend Maxinya, but sword play, and leaping from tree to tree does.  
 

Creators

Drawn by noted golden age artist Raboy (Captain Marvel Jr. and the Black Terror) the adventures of Dr. Voodoo were like those of Prince Valiant, only set in a jungle, with Hal, Maxinya and Maxinya’s jaguar companion Jappa facing down everything from headhunters, to tribes of giants, to dragons.

deck: Vice President in The Boys, an incompetent moron that is backed by Vought American
description:
Through the machinations of the Vought American corporation, the incredibly simple-minded former C.E.O of the company, Victor Neuman found his way to the vice-presidency of the United States in the year 2000. They plan to eventually have him displace the current President, then implement policy according to their wishes. It is due to his family background, blank slate mentality and loyalty that led Vought to consider the best candidate for this.
Vic is adamantly opposed by the President himself, Dakota Bob, who never wished to have Vic as a running mate but was forced to take him on regardless by the Republican party. Vought's ultimate goal, to have superhuman power adopted as national defense, is one that Bob will do everything in his power to prevent.

deck: Tamerkhan is an Aquaman foe. He was a Mongol sorcerer-scientist who made himself effectively immortal. His plan of taking over Atlantis involved aging Aquababy to a man and marrying said man to his daughter.
description:
Creation

Tamerkhan was created by Nick Cardy and Bob Haney.

Major Story Arcs

Aquaman

Tamerkhan was a Mongol sorcerer-scientist who once loyally served Genghis Khan (reigned 1206 - 1227). Once Genghis died, The Mongol Empire fell. (Historically the succession of Genghis was a relatively peaceful one and the Empire was mostly stable to c. 1260. Then the various constituent states of the Empire started gaining independence, led by various branches of his dynasty. The main branch was the Yuan dynasty which continued ruling China to 1368). Tamerkhan and associate Attucka fled to the oceans. He used his science to make them both effectively immortal and able to live and breathe underwater.

The duo turned to piracy and around the 1560s, Tamerkhan gained himself a wife. She was an unnamed princess captured in a raid. She died eventually but left behind a daughter, Liat. A daughter also rendered immortal by Tamerkhan. By the 1960s, the trio were living in a submarine. They located Atlantis and were conspiring on ways of conquering it when Aquababy entered their ship uninvited. Substances from Tamerkhan's lab were used to age the baby to a teenage Aquaboy. Liat was quick to pick the cute guy as her mate. Tamerkhan had to comply and was properly introduced to his prospective son-in-law.

Learning the boy was a Prince of Atlantis, they figured a way to enter the Royal Family of the city. Arthur and Mera were a bit surprised their son was all grown-up and engaged to be married. But they reluctantly complied. Until finding out Tamerkhan kept Junior under control with hypnotism. (He had no objection to dating Liat. But resisted the idea of pledging to "love her alone"). The other three Royals reacted violently. but Aqualad was no match in unarmed combat for Aquaboy, taken down with a single move. Tamerkhan's ring was able to dissolve the hard-water creations of Mera. Aquaman surrendered without a fight.

The Mongols were able to take over Atlantis with no further resistance. But where force failed, cunning succeeded. Mera started seducing Tamerkhan and even suggested methods of disposing Aquaman. A flattered Tamerkhan let his guard down and was unable to stop her from stealing his amulet. She quickly threw it to Arthur, who destroyed it. Tamerkhan was unable to hypnotize anyone. He still rushed the wedding of Junior and Liat. But Junior was de-aged as the chemicals wore off. He stole and swallowed the ring of his prospective father-in-law.

While Attucka was killed in battle with Aquaman, Tamerkhan and Liat crumpled away to dust, their bodies ageing to their actual ages. The ring was apparently the artifact keeping them alive.
